document_title: Chronic tonsillitis: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Treatment of chronic tonsillitis requires careful consideration. Treatments may include:
1. Antibiotics
MSc.BSc.CKI Nguyen Thi Thuc Nhu said that for patients at high risk of bacterial tonsillitis based on Centor criteria, antigen testing or throat culture, antibiotics are often used in the treatment. treat. Antibiotics can reduce suppurative complications and symptom duration.
Streptococcus pyogenes is the most common cause of bacterial tonsillitis and if antibiotic treatment is considered appropriate, penicillin is usually the antibiotic of choice.(2)
In patients allergic to penicillin, antibiotic therapy with azithromycin or cephalosporin is equivalent to treatment with penicillin.
Antibiotic use is often recommended in patients with high rates of complications, especially rheumatic heart disease and rheumatic fever. However, using antibiotics can have risks such as increased resistance to bacteria, digestive disorders, diarrhea, and Clostridium difficile infection. Therefore, patients should only use it as prescribed by their doctor, and do not arbitrarily buy antibiotics for treatment.
2. Surgery
Tonsillectomy is often considered in patients with recurrent tonsillitis who have 4-5 episodes of tonsillitis in a year. Tonsillectomy aims to remove inflammation in the oropharynx, prevent respiratory diseases and improve patient health.
Tonsillectomy is also considered in patients with the following complications:(3)
Sleep apnea, snoring;; Treated with antibiotics but condition did not improve;; Difficulty swallowing;; Breathing is difficult.
Currently, modern tonsillectomy techniques do not cause pain, stop bleeding on the spot, and are especially suitable for children. For example, Tam Anh General Hospital applies Coblator Plasma technology, using a low-heat scalpel to stop bleeding on the spot to quickly remove all overgrown tonsils. Surgery time is only about 30 minutes, limiting the amount of anesthesia used. Children can talk, eat and drink 3 hours after surgery and leave the hospital after 24 hours. With this surgery, children do not experience pain so it does not affect their psychology.
Tonsillectomy surgery using Coblator Plasma technology is painless and stops bleeding on the spot, especially suitable for children at Tam Anh General Hospital in Ho Chi Minh City.
